column4: anyone know where to begin figuring out whats wrong with the connection manager thingy?
does it run?
well its little icon isnt' there, is there a command to run it attached to a console and see if it puts something ins stdout
yup, just upgraded from 8.04 to 8.10
not sure, you could try installing wifi-radar
sudo iwlist scan
does that command show any wireless networks?
ok so the device is working
where does the icon in the gnome menu point to?
you could get a wired connection then sudo apt-get --reinstall  install nm-applet
how about gksudo networkmanager
id get a wired connection or add your install cd as a repo and install wifi-radar
i'm on wired right now
sudo apt-get install wifi-radar
i'm actually on the computer i'm having trouble with
you can then configure wireless with that
alright, that works but why is network manager broke?
no idea, i use kde, but i kno of wifi-manager
glad yuo got it woking dude
thanks for your help, wifi-radar seems quite sweet
yep, i think its better than the default thing
